column1: This is an infection of the prostate gland.
Chronic prostatitis is treated with antibiotics for 4 to 12 weeks or longer.
It is harder for antibiotics to get into prostate tissue to treat the infection.

Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medicines (NSAIDs), such as ibuprofen or naproxen, may help with pain or discomfort.
